str2: Woe!, alas!, uttered in grief or denunciation. A primary exclamation of grief; 'woe'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
